meta.article_title: February 11, 2013 - Winning with Backspin for the Non-Chopper

winning-with-backspin-for-the-non-choppe.probleme: When to use backspin in a rally

debutant.description: Keep the ball very low to the net, and brush it back lightly with backspin. This makes it easier to keep the ball low and short.

intermediaire.description: If you are out of position and have to reach for the ball, a better answer might be a backhand chop. This keeps you in the rally, gives you time to get back into the point, and it may throw off the opponent's timing.

avance.description: Push quick, low, heavy, deep, and at wide angles (or to the middle against some two-winged players). Aim one way, and at the last second change directions.
